00029 using namespace std;
00030 using namespace pwiz::util;
00031 using namespace pwiz::msdata;

00033 
00034 ostream* os_ = 0;
00035 
00036 
00037 class Reader1 : public Reader
00038 {
00039     public:
00040 
00041     struct Config
00042     {
00043         string name;
00044         mutable bool done;
00045         Config() : name("default"), done(false) {}
00046     };
00047 
00048     Config config;
00049 
00050     virtual bool accept(const std::string& filename, const std::string& head) const
00051     {
00052         bool result = (filename == "1"); 
00053         if (os_) *os_ << "Reader1::accept(): " << boolalpha << result << endl;
00054         return result;
00055     }
00056 
00057     virtual void read(const std::string& filename, 
00058                       const std::string& head,
00059                       MSData& result) const 
00060     {
00061         if (os_) *os_ << "Reader1::read()\n";
00062         config.done = true;
00063     }
00064 };
00065 
00066 
00067 class Reader2 : public Reader
00068 {
00069     public:
00070 
00071     struct Config
00072     {
00073         string color;
00074         mutable bool done;
00075         Config() : color("orange"), done(false) {}
00076     };
00077 
00078     Config config;
00079 
00080     virtual bool accept(const std::string& filename, const std::string& head) const
00081     {
00082         bool result = (filename == "2"); 
00083         if (os_) *os_ << "Reader2::accept(): " << boolalpha << result << endl;
00084         return result;
00085     }
00086 
00087     virtual void read(const std::string& filename, 
00088                       const std::string& head,
00089                       MSData& result) const
00090     {
00091         if (os_) *os_ << "Reader2::read()\n";
00092         config.done = true;
00093     }
00094 };

00096 
00097 void testGet()
00098 {
00099     if (os_) *os_ << "testGet()\n";
00100 
00101     ReaderList readers;
00102     readers.push_back(ReaderPtr(new Reader1));
00103     readers.push_back(ReaderPtr(new Reader2));
00104 
00105     unit_assert(readers.size() == 2);
00106 
00107     Reader1* reader1 = readers.get<Reader1>();
00108     unit_assert(reader1);
00109     if (os_) *os_ << "reader1 config: " << reader1->config.name << endl; 
00110     unit_assert(reader1->config.name == "default");
00111     reader1->config.name = "raw";
00112     if (os_) *os_ << "reader1 config: " << reader1->config.name << endl; 
00113     unit_assert(reader1->config.name == "raw");
00114 
00115     Reader2* reader2 = readers.get<Reader2>();
00116     unit_assert(reader2);
00117     if (os_) *os_ << "reader2 config: " << reader2->config.color << endl; 
00118     unit_assert(reader2->config.color == "orange");
00119     reader2->config.color = "purple";
00120     if (os_) *os_ << "reader2 config: " << reader2->config.color << endl; 
00121     unit_assert(reader2->config.color == "purple");
00122 
00123     const ReaderList& const_readers = readers;
00124     const Reader2* constReader2 = const_readers.get<Reader2>();
00125     unit_assert(constReader2);
00126     if (os_) *os_ << "constReader2 config: " << constReader2->config.color << endl; 
00127 
00128     if (os_) *os_ << endl;
00129 }
00130 
00131 
00132 void testAccept()
00133 {
00134     if (os_) *os_ << "testAccept()\n";
00135 
00136     ReaderList readers;
00137     readers.push_back(ReaderPtr(new Reader1));
00138     readers.push_back(ReaderPtr(new Reader2));
00139 
00140     if (os_) *os_ << "accept 1:\n";
00141     unit_assert(readers.accept("1", "head"));
00142     if (os_) *os_ << "accept 2:\n";
00143     unit_assert(readers.accept("2", "head"));
00144     if (os_) *os_ << "accept 3:\n";
00145     unit_assert(!readers.accept("3", "head"));
00146 
00147     if (os_) *os_ << endl;
00148 }
00149 
00150 
00151 void testRead()
00152 {
00153     if (os_) *os_ << "testRead()\n";
00154 
00155     ReaderList readers;
00156     readers.push_back(ReaderPtr(new Reader1));
00157     readers.push_back(ReaderPtr(new Reader2));
00158 
00159     MSData msd;
00160 
00161     // note: composite pattern with accept/read will cause two calls
00162     // to accept(); the alternative is to maintain state between accept()
00163     // and read(), which opens possibility for misuse. 
00164 
00165     unit_assert(readers.get<Reader1>()->config.done == false);
00166     if (readers.accept("1", "head"))
00167         readers.read("1", "head", msd);
00168     unit_assert(readers.get<Reader1>()->config.done == true);
00169 
00170     readers.get<Reader1>()->config.done = false;
00171     unit_assert(readers.get<Reader2>()->config.done == false);
00172     if (readers.accept("2", "head"))
00173         readers.read("2", "head", msd);
00174     unit_assert(readers.get<Reader1>()->config.done == false);
00175     unit_assert(readers.get<Reader2>()->config.done == true);
00176 
00177     if (os_) *os_ << endl;
00178 }
00179 
00180 
00181 void test()
00182 {
00183     testGet();
00184     testAccept();
00185     testRead();
00186 }
00187 
00188 
00189 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00190 {
00191     try
00192     {
00193         if (argc==2 && !strcmp(argv[1],"-v")) os_ = &cout;
00194         test();
00195         return 0;
00196     }
00197     catch (exception& e)
00198     {
00199         cerr << e.what() << endl;
00200     }
00201     catch (...)
00202     {
00203         cerr << "Caught unknown exception.\n";
00204     }
00205     
00206     return 1;
00207 }
